citation: István Perczel, “Some Early Documents about the Interactions of the Saint Thomas Christians and the European Missionaries,” in Malabar in the Indian Ocean: Cosmopolitanism in a Maritime Historical Region, ed. Mahmood Kooria and Michael Naylor Pearson (New Delhi: Oxford University Press, 2018), 76–120.

data.title: Some Early Documents about the Interactions of the Saint Thomas Christians and the European Missionaries
data.abstractNote: This is an anthology of documents, translated from Latin, Portuguese, Syriac and Malayalam, about the interactions of the Indian Syrian Christians, their West Asian prelates and the European missionaries at the Malabar Coast, in the second half of the sixteenth century and the first decades of the seventeenth. The documents, many of which have been discovered recently, during an ongoing research project for exploring the Indian Syrian Christian archives, show how these complicated and entangled interactions contributed to the birth of a complex, synthetic early modern culture in South-west India.
data.bookTitle: Malabar in the Indian Ocean: Cosmopolitanism in a Maritime Historical Region
